ygData.subject: Re: Re:Re: Guise of the Deceiver (Longish)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Ah, now things start to make sense.  UO and EQ are rather different.  EQ is advancement-based.  UO is interaction-based. In UO, I would probably agree with
ygData.messageBody:
On Mon, 13 Dec 1999 silky@... wrote:
>
> Well, I've had this same discussion going on for about - god...can it be
> almost 3 years now?...over on the UO front.

Ah, now things start to make sense. UO and EQ are rather
different. EQ is advancement-based. UO is interaction-based.
In UO, I would probably agree with most everything you've
said. In EQ, advancement depends on finding things to kill,
which depends on how many things there are to kill, which
depends on how quickly everyone else is killing them, which is
why I've been disagreeing with you.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
